text: LEN European Junior Water Polo Championship is an continental water polo tournament held every two years for the players under the age of 17. ==Men's tournament== ===History=== {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;font-size:90%" |- style="background: #efefef;" !width=10%|Year !width=20%|Host !width=20%|20px Gold !width=20%|20px Silver !width=20%|20px Bronze |- align=center |2003 | Turkey,Istanbul |'''''' | | |- align=center |2005 | Bulgaria,Sofia |'''''' | | |- align=center |2007 | Malta,Valletta |'''''' | | |- align=center |2008 | Serbia,Belgrade |'''''' | | |- align=center |2009 | Greece,Chania |'''''' | | |- align=center |2011 | Croatia,Rijeka |'''''' | | |- align=center |2013 | Malta,VallettaMontenegro claims gold medal - Malta day 8 |'''''' | | |- align=center |2015 | Azerbaijan,Baku |'''''' | | |- align=center |2017 | Malta,Valletta2017 hosts by LEN |'''''' | | |- align=center |2019 | Georgia,Tbilisi2019 Men's European Junior Water Polo Championships |'''''' | | |- align=center |} ==Women's tournament== ===History=== {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;font-size:90%" |- style="background: #efefef;" !width=10%|Year !width=20%|Host !width=20%|20px Gold !width=20%|20px Silver !width=20%|20px Bronze |- align=center |2011 | Madrid, Spain |'''''' | | |- align=center |2013 | Istanbul, TurkeyGreece on top again - Istanbul day 7 |'''''' | | |- align=center |2015 | Baku, Azerbaijan |'''''' | | |- align=center |2017 | Novi Sad, SerbiaLEN Women's European Junior Water Polo Championships 2017 | | | |- align=center |2019 | Volos, GreeceLEN Women's European Junior Water Polo Championships 2019 | | | |} ==References== Category:LEN water polo competitions Category:International water polo competitions Waterpolo Category:Under-17 sport
title: LEN European Junior Water Polo Championship
